intro: Entandrophragma gillardini, commonly known as the African teak or African rosewood, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood that is highly valued for furniture and musical instruments. The plant has bipinnate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by elongated, bean-like pods. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
